articles.title: Earth’s Invisible Shield Rebounds: The Remarkable 2024 Ozone Recovery - SciTechDaily
articles.description: In 2024, the ozone hole over the Antarctic showed a notable reduction in size, ranking as the seventh smallest since monitoring began post-Montreal Protocol. This improvement is credited to ongoing reductions in CFC emissions and enhanced atmospheric dynamics…
articles.content:
September 28, 2024
In 2024, the ozone hole over the Antarctic showed a notable reduction in size, ranking as the seventh smallest since monitoring began post-Montreal Protocol.

articles.author: Richard Tribou, Orlando Sentinel
articles.title: NASA's Starliner astronauts to achieve feat, technically, during SpaceX Dragon relocation - Phys.org
articles.description: A parking spot shuffle coming up this weekend more than 250 miles above Earth will mark a unique feat for a pair of NASA astronauts who will become the first to fly in both Boeing's Starliner and SpaceX's Crew Dragon spacecraft.
